attributes.action: grant the childcare element of tax credit to families in which one parent returns to full-time education and still require childcare to attend their course/university.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently, unless both parties are working 16 hours a week or more, you are not entitled to the childcare element of tax credit.  
However if you are attending a full time university course you still require full time childcare.  
University courses or any course for that matter come with a great deal of work themselves without having to work an extra 16hrs per week and it is more time spent away from the home.
Many mature students have had to drop out due to the pressures of combining the course and children alone. 
It is prefered that you concentrate on the course as research has shown that students who work part time on top of their courses don't tend to do as well as those who didn't take up part time work.  
When one parent is working and having to pay huge amounts for childcare, it can be a strain on finances and relationships.
Surely if children have to attend a childminder or nursery, the families are entitled to the childcare element
